SEARCH

Class DiceGame

java.lang.Object
DiceGame
public class DiceGame extends Object
This is a basic dice game written in Java. A simple menu to either play, show results, or quit is displayed. Current gameplay averages and overall averages are displayed through file operations.
Author:
Alex Jimenez

    • DiceGame

      public DiceGame()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • menu

      public static int menu()
      Function creates the user menu with three options for users to pick from. Input validation makes sure 1-3 is entered.
      Returns:
      a number 1-3

    • usersGuess

      public static int usersGuess()
      Function gets user input to guess the dice roll. Keyboard receives the users dice # guess.
      Returns:
      a number 1-6

    • roll_dice

      public static int roll_dice()
      Function generate a random dice roll 1-6 then prints it in a message.
      Returns:
      a number 1-6

    • anotherRound

      public static String anotherRound()
      Function gets user input to determine is another round is played. Uses input validation to make sure y or n is entered.
      Returns:
      the string y or the string n

    • Gameplay

      public static int Gameplay(int wins)
      Function calls methods to test if the users dice # guess was correct.
      Parameters:
      wins - is passed to continue accumulating user wins
      Returns:
      users updated number of wins

    • fileWriting

      public static void fileWriting(int wins, double rounds) throws IOException
      Function appends the users current win percentage to count.txt. Prints current win ratio, # of rounds, and # of wins.
      Parameters:
      wins - and rounds are used to calculate percentages and decimals
      Throws:
      IOException

    • DisplayFileAverage

      public static void DisplayFileAverage() throws IOException
      Function reads all game averages from a file and calculates an overall average. This overall average is rounded 2 decimal places and printed for the user.
      Throws:
      IOException
